Expected value: country or sea name (INSDC or GAZ): region(GAZ), specific location name
Definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ).

Elevation of the sampling site is its height above a fixed reference point, most commonly the mean sea level. Elevation is mainly used when referring to points on the earth's surface, while altitude is used for points above the surface, such as an aircraft in flight or a spacecraft in orbit.
Electrical conductivity of water.

Expected value: name and version of software, parameters used
Definition: Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.
Relationships to other hosts in the same study; can include multiple relationships
The level of genome modification.

Expected value: non-mineral nutrient name;non-mineral nutrient amount;treatment interval and duration
Preferred unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens
Soil series name or other lower-level classification

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, micromole per liter
Definition: Total carbon content

Genetic modifications of the genome of an organism, which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means, e.g. specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection.
Location of sampled soil to other parts of the farm e.g. under crop plant, near irrigation ditch, from the dirt road

A descriptor for the method of movement of food commodity along the food distribution system.  This field accepts terms listed under travel mode (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001064). If the proper descrptor is not listed please use text to describe the mode of travel. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.
Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling.

Expected value: name and version of software, parameters used
Definition: Tool(s) used for assembly, including version number and parameters

Preferred unit: meter per second, kilometer per hour
Definition: Speed of wind measured at the time of sampling
Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius
Measurement of the culture rooting medium micronutrients (Fe, Mn, Zn, B, Cu, Mo); e.g. H3BO3 (6.2¬†mg/L).

A reference to a place on the Earth, by its name or by its geographical location that refers to a distribution point along the food chain. This field accepts terms listed under geographic location (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GAZ_00000448). Reference: Adam Diamond, James Barham. Moving Food Along the Value Chain: Innovations in Regional Food Distribution. U.S. Dept. of Agriculture, Agricultural Marketing Service. Washington, DC. March 2012. http://dx.doi.org/10.9752/MS045.03-2012.
True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original temperature was measured (e.g. 1345 m).
Observed genotype

Expected value: country or sea name (INSDC or GAZ): region(GAZ), specific location name
Definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology  (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ).
Sampling room number. This ID should be consistent with the designations on the building floor plans
Reference or method used in determining soil texture
Temperature of soil at the time of sampling.

Expected value: original symbiotic organism (host of the samples) body habitat where the sample was obtained from; free text
Definition: Original body habitat where the sample was obtained from.
Conductivity of some soil.
Ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen
Common name of the host.
Refers to the mesh/pore size used to retain the sample. Materials smaller than the size threshold are excluded from the sample.

Item: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Definition: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term Sample Size (MIXS:0000001).

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, micromole per liter
Definition: Total nitrogen content of the sample
Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized.

Value syntax: [autotroph| carboxydotroph| chemoautotroph| chemoheterotroph| chemolithoautotroph| chemolithotroph| chemoorganoheterotroph| chemoorganotroph| chemosynthetic| chemotroph| copiotroph| diazotroph| facultative| autotroph| heterotroph| lithoautotroph| lithoheterotroph| lithotroph| methanotroph| methylotroph| mixotroph| obligate| chemoautolithotroph| oligotroph| organoheterotroph| organotroph| photoautotroph| photoheterotroph| photolithoautotroph| photolithotroph| photosynthetic| phototroph]
Definition: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

This is the scientific role or category that the subject organism or material has with respect to an investigation.  This field accepts terms listed under specimen (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001237 or http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0100051).
The maximum number of product units within a package.
Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room. Indicate the location name.

Expected value: standing water type;treatment interval and duration
Definition: Treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens

Expected value: The material displaced by the entity at time of sampling. Recommend subclasses of environmental material [ENVO:00010483].
Definition: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

Expected value: gravidity status of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples);timestamp
Definition: Whether or not subject is gravid, and if yes date due or date post-conception, specifying which is used.
The growth substrate of the host.
Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)
The length of subject

The taxonomic name of the organism(s) found living in mutualistic, commensalistic, or parasitic symbiosis with the specific host. The sampled symbiont can have its own symbionts. For example, parasites may have hyperparasites (=parasites of the parasite).
Amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling
Information about treatment(s) involving use of biotic factors, such as bacteria, viruses or fungi.
Measurement of the culture rooting medium micronutrients (Fe, Mn, Zn, B, Cu, Mo); e.g. H3BO3 (6.2 mg/L).
The number of times the sample location is cleaned. Frequency of cleaning might be on a Daily basis, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly or Annually.
A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

A distinctive alpha-numeric identification code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product within a batch. Synonym: Batch Number. The submitter should provide lot number of the item followed by the item name for which the lot number was provided.

Preferred unit: formazin turbidity unit, formazin nephelometric units
Definition: Measure of the amount of cloudiness or haziness in water caused by individual particles

Expected value: decimal degrees, limit to 8 decimal points
Definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system.
Description of the feeding equipment used for livestock. This field accepts terms listed under feed delivery (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001757). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.
The level of genome modification
Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here
Total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

Expected value: The major environment type(s) where the sample was collected. Recommend subclasses of biome [ENVO:00000428]. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.
Definition: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class:  http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS

Value syntax: [Finished genome|High-quality draft genome|Medium-quality draft genome|Low-quality draft genome|Genome fragment(s)]
Definition: The assembly quality category is based on sets of criteria outlined for each assembly quality category. For MISAG/MIMAG; Finished: Single, validated, contiguous sequence per replicon without gaps or ambiguities with a consensus error rate equivalent to Q50 or better. High Quality Draft:Multiple fragments where gaps span repetitive regions. Presence of the 23S, 16S and 5S rRNA genes and at least 18 tRNAs. Medium Quality Draft:Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics. Low Quality Draft:Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics. Assembly statistics include, but are not limited to total assembly size, number of contigs, contig N50/L50, and maximum contig length. For MIUVIG; Finished: Single, validated, contiguous sequence per replicon without gaps or ambiguities, with extensive manual review and editing to annotate putative gene functions and transcriptional units. High-quality draft genome: One or multiple fragments, totaling ≥ 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence or predicted complete. Genome fragment(s): One or multiple fragments, totalling < 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence, or for which no genome size could be estimated

Preferred unit: gram per cubic meter, gram per cubic centimeter
Definition: Density of the sample, which is its mass per unit volume (aka volumetric mass density)

Expected value: Relationships to other symbiotic organisms (host od samples) in the same study; relationship type;arbitrary identifier
Definition: Relationships to other hosts in the same study; can include multiple relationships.
The color of host

Value syntax: [Finished genome|High-quality draft genome|Medium-quality draft genome|Low-quality draft genome|Genome fragment(s)]
Definition: The assembly quality category is based on sets of criteria outlined for each assembly quality category. For MISAG/MIMAG; Finished: Single, validated, contiguous sequence per replicon without gaps or ambiguities with a consensus error rate equivalent to Q50 or better. High Quality Draft:Multiple fragments where gaps span repetitive regions. Presence of the 23S, 16S and 5S rRNA genes and at least 18 tRNAs. Medium Quality Draft:Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics. Low Quality Draft:Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics. Assembly statistics include, but are not limited to total assembly size, number of contigs, contig N50/L50, and maximum contig length. For MIUVIG; Finished: Single, validated, contiguous sequence per replicon without gaps or ambiguities, with extensive manual review and editing to annotate putative gene functions and transcriptional units. High-quality draft genome: One or multiple fragments, totaling ≥ 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence or predicted complete. Genome fragment(s): One or multiple fragments, totalling < 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence, or for which no genome size could be estimated

Expected value: Add terms that identify the material displaced by the entity at time of sampling. Recommend subclasses of environmental material [ENVO:00010483]. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes e.g.: estuarine water [ENVO:01000301]|estuarine mud [ENVO:00002160]
Definition: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).
Wind direction is the direction from which a wind originates
Ventilation system used in the sampled premises.
Concentration of alkyl diethers
pH measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid.
The taxonomic name of the organism(s) found living in mutualistic, commensalistic, or parasitic symbiosis with the specific host.
The average of all seasonal precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps.
Indicate whether multiple DNA extractions were mixed. If the answer yes, the number of extracts that were pooled should be given

Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI
Indicate whether multiple DNA extractions were mixed. If the answer yes, the number of extracts that were pooled should be given.
Reference or method used in determining soil texture.

Value syntax: {termLabel} {[termID]} or [husk|other artificial liquid medium|other artificial solid medium|peat moss|perlite|pumice|sand|soil|vermiculite|water]
Definition: Specification of the media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples, e.g. soil, aeroponic, hydroponic, in vitro solid culture medium, in vitro liquid culture medium. Recommended value is a specific value from EO:plant growth medium (follow this link for terms http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/EO_0007147) or other controlled vocabulary
Duration for which the sample was stored
Whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule

Expected value: Literature reference giving growth conditions of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples); PMID,DOI,url or free text
Definition: Literature reference giving growth conditions of the host.

Expected value: perturbation type name;perturbation interval and duration
Definition: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types
Temperature of the air at the time of sampling.
Reference or method used in determining total organic carbon

Preferred unit: formazin turbidity unit, formazin nephelometric units, nephelometric turbidity units
Definition: Measure of the amount of cloudiness or haziness in water caused by individual particles

Concentration of substances that remain suspended in the air, and comprise mixtures of organic and inorganic substances (PM10 and PM2.5); can report multiple PM's by entering numeric values preceded by name of PM
Type of plant or animal from which the food product or its major ingredient is derived or a chemical food source [FDA CFSAN 1995].

Expected value: shape of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples)
Definition: Morphological shape of host.

Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a water sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater

The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008; Except: 2008-01; 2008 all are ISO8601 compliant.
Common name of the host.
Reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification.

Expected value: salt name;salt amount;treatment interval and duration
Preferred unit: gram, microgram, mole per liter, gram per liter
Definition: Information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple salt regimens
List of planting, growing or harvesting equipment shared with other farms.
Oxygenation status of sample
Surface materials at the point of sampling.
A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample.
Reference or method used in determining soil texture classification.

Expected value: height of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples); measurement value
Definition: The height of subject.
Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid

Genetic modifications of the genome of an organism, which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means, e.g. specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection.

Phenotype of human or other host. For phenotypic quality ontology (pato) (v 2018-03-27) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/pato. For Human Phenotype Ontology (HP) (v 2018-06-13) please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/HP

Expected value: body site of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples) where the samples was obtained from; FMA or UBERON
Definition: Name of body site where the sample was obtained from, such as a specific organ or tissue (tongue, lung etc...). For foundational model of anatomy ontology (fma) (v 4.11.0) or Uber-anatomy ontology (UBERON) (v releases/2014-06-15) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/FMA or http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/UBERON.

Expected value: cardinal wind direction or azimuth degrees
Definition: Wind direction is the direction from which a wind originates.

Value syntax: {termLabel} {[termID]} or [husk|other artificial liquid medium|other artificial solid medium|peat moss|perlite|pumice|sand|soil|vermiculite|water]
Definition: Specification of the media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples, e.g. soil, aeroponic, hydroponic, in vitro solid culture medium, in vitro liquid culture medium. Recommended value is a specific value from EO:plant growth medium (follow this link for terms http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/EO_0007147) or other controlled vocabulary

The season when sampling occurred. Any of the four periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices. This field accepts terms listed under season (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C94729).

Expected value: decimal degrees, limit to 8 decimal points
Definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

Treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple climates

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Dissolved inorganic carbon concentration in the sample, typically measured after filtering the sample using a 0.45 micrometer filter
A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence.
Oxygenation status of sample.

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, practical salinity unit, percentage
Definition: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid (in the form of an extract obtained by centrifugation) sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater

The device used to collect an environmental sample. This field accepts terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO). This field also accepts terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

Expected value: standing water type;treatment interval and duration
Definition: Treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens

Expected value: age of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples); value
Definition: Age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. Could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees.

Item: amount or size of sample collected
Definition: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.
Concentration of particulate organic carbon
Porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample.

List of planting, growing or harvesting equipment shared with other farms. This field accepts terms listed under agricultural implement (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000416). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

Preferred unit: cubic meter per minute, liters per second
Definition: Ventilation rate of the system in the sampled premises.

Treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple climates
The average of all seasonal precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps.

Item: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Definition: Volume (ml), weight (g) of processed sample, or surface area swabbed from sample for DNA extraction.

Preferred unit: gram per gram or cubic centimeter per cubic centimeter
Definition: Water content measurement

Information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room.

Expected value: fungicide name;fungicide amount;treatment interval and duration
Preferred unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple fungicide regimens

Expected value: pesticide name;pesticide amount;treatment interval and duration
Preferred unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple pesticide regimens

Genetic modifications of the genome of an organism, which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means, e.g. specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection
Observed genotype.

Description of the feeding equipment used for livestock. This field accepts terms listed under feed delivery (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001757). Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.
A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

A local identifier or name that for the material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. It can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible. INSDC requires every sample name from a single Submitter to be unique. Use of a globally unique identifier for the field source_mat_id is recommended in addition to sample_name.
Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius.

Packaged kits (containing adapters, indexes, enzymes, buffers etc.), tailored for specific sequencing workflows, which allow the simplified preparation of sequencing-ready libraries for small genomes, amplicons, and plasmids.
Reference or method used in determining total organic carbon.

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, micromole per liter
Definition: Concentration of organic nitrogen

Expected value: symbionts of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples). e.g.: annotating a sample collected from a trematode with a nematomorpha cyst consider: species name of the nematomorph; {species name} or {common name}
Definition: The taxonomic name of the organism(s) found living in mutualistic, commensalistic, or parasitic symbiosis with the specific host. For cases when the specific host of the sample is a symbiont this field should refer to other organisms it is associated with. E.g.: hyperparasite species X (parasite of the parasite)

Preferred unit: number of cells per cubic meter, number of cells per milliliter, number of cells per cubic centimeter
Definition: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)
Previous land use and dates.
Information about treatment(s) involving use of biotic factors, such as bacteria, viruses or fungi.
Characteristic shape, appearance or growth form of a plant species.

Preferred unit: kilowatts per square meter per day, ergs per square centimeter per second
Definition: The amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval
Reference or method used in determining ph

Expected value: symbionts of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples). e.g.: annotating a sample collected from a trematode with a nematomorpha cyst consider: species name of the nematomorph; {species name} or {common name}
Definition: The taxonomic name of the organism(s) found living in mutualistic, commensalistic, or parasitic symbiosis with the specific host. For cases when the specific host of the sample is a symbiont this field should refer to other organisms it is associated with. E.g.: hyperparasite species X (parasite of the parasite).

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2
Method used to sanitize growing and harvesting equipment including type and concentration of sanitizing solution and frequency of sanitization.

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, microgram per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2

A food product type is a class of food products that is differentiated by its food composition (e.g., single- or multi-ingredient), processing and/or consumption characteristics. This does not include brand name products but it may include generic food dish categories. This field accepts terms under food product type (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON:03400361). For terms related to food product for an animal, consult food product for animal (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03309997). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food type. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of dissolved inorganic phosphorus in the sample

Item: amount or size of sample collected
Definition: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

Information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens

A harvesting process is a process which takes in some food material from an individual or community of plant or animal organisms in a given context and time, and outputs a precursor or consumable food product. This may include a part of an organism or the whole, and may involve killing the organism.
Description of the material covering the sampled soil. This field accepts terms under ENVO:00010483, environmental material.

Preferred unit: gram Carbon per kilogram sample material
Definition: Definition for soil: total organic carbon content of the soil, definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

Altitude is a term used to identify heights of objects such as airplanes, space shuttles, rockets, atmospheric balloons and heights of places such as atmospheric layers and clouds. It is used to measure the height of an object which is above the earth's surface. In this context, the altitude measurement is the vertical distance between the earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air

The total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater.
Refers to the mesh/pore size used to retain the sample. Materials smaller than the size threshold are excluded from the sample

Altitude is a term used to identify heights of objects such as airplanes, space shuttles, rockets, atmospheric balloons and heights of places such as atmospheric layers and clouds. It is used to measure the height of an object which is above the earth's surface. In this context, the altitude measurement is the vertical distance between the earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air
Reference or method used in determining the total nitrogen.

Expected value: text or commercial name of sanitizer or class of sanitizer or active ingredient in sanitizer
Definition: Method used to sanitize growing and harvesting equipment. This can including type and concentration of sanitizing solution.  Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

A local identifier or name that for the material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. It can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible. INSDC requires every sample name from a single Submitter to be unique. Use of a globally unique identifier for the field source_mat_id is recommended in addition to sample_name.

A harvesting process is a process which takes in some food material from an individual or community of plant or animal organisms in a given context and time, and outputs a precursor or consumable food product. This may include a part of an organism or the whole, and may involve killing the organism.
Tool used for annotation, or for cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

A distinctive alpha-numeric identification code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product within a batch. Synonym: Batch Number.  The submitter should provide lot number of the item followed by the item name for which the lot number was provided.
Concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes

Information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
Whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, milligram per cubic meter
Definition: Concentration of organic matter
Explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction (fresh/frozen/other).
Measurement of dry mass.

Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI.
Whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule.

Expected value: mass of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples); measurement value
Definition: Total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host.

Expected value: symbiotic organism (host of the samples) specific phenotype ontology terms; OBA or PTO or free text
Definition: Phenotype of human or other host. For phenotypic quality ontology (pato) (v 2018-03-27) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/pato. For Human Phenotype Ontology (HP) (v 2018-06-13) please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/HP.
The floor of the building, where the sampling room is located

Expected value: perturbation type name;perturbation interval and duration
Definition: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types
Duration for which the sample was stored.

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes
Refers to the mesh/pore size used to pre-filter/pre-sort the sample. Materials larger than the size threshold are excluded from the sample.
Information about either pedigree or other ancestral information description (e.g. parental variety in case of mutant or selection), e.g. A/3*B (meaning [(A x B) x B] x B).
Mean seasonal air temperature.

Phenotype of human or other host. For phenotypic quality ontology (pato) (v 2018-03-27) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/pato. For Human Phenotype Ontology (HP) (v 2018-06-13) please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/HP

The season when sampling occurred. Any of the four periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices. This field accepts terms listed under season (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C94729).
Description of life stage of host

Expected value: name of tool or pipeline used, or annotation source description
Definition: Tool used for annotation, or for cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter
Information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites.

A reference to a place on the Earth, by its name or by its geographical location that refers to a distribution point along the food chain. This field accepts terms listed under geographic location (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GAZ_00000448). Reference: Adam Diamond, James Barham. Moving Food Along the Value Chain: Innovations in Regional Food Distribution. U.S. Dept. of Agriculture, Agricultural Marketing Service. Washington, DC. March 2012. http://dx.doi.org/10.9752/MS045.03-2012.

Physical combination of several instances of like material, e.g. RNA extracted from samples or dishes of cell cultures into one big aliquot of cells. Please provide a short description of the samples that were pooled.
A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence.
A unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified.
Surface materials at the point of sampling

Information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of ph of the growth media, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimen
Measurement of the culture rooting medium macronutrients (N,P, K, Ca, Mg, S); e.g. KH2PO4 (170 mg/L).
Previous land use and dates

Preferred unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens

Expected value: disease name or Disease Ontology term
Definition: List of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at https://www.disease-ontology.org, non-human host diseases are free text

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million, micromole per liter
Definition: Concentration of dissolved inorganic phosphorus in the sample

Expected value: disease name or Disease Ontology term
Definition: List of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at https://www.disease-ontology.org, non-human host diseases are free text

Item: Interagency Food Safety Analytics Collaboration (IFSAC) category
Definition: The IFSAC food categorization scheme has five distinct levels to which foods can be assigned, depending upon the type of food. First, foods are assigned to one of four food groups (aquatic animals, land animals, plants, and other). Food groups include increasingly specific food categories; dairy, eggs, meat and poultry, and game are in the land animal food group, and the category meat and poultry is further subdivided into more specific categories of meat (beef, pork, other meat) and poultry (chicken, turkey, other poultry). Finally, foods are differentiated by differences in food processing (such as pasteurized fluid dairy products, unpasteurized fluid dairy products, pasteurized solid and semi-solid dairy products, and unpasteurized solid and semi-solid dairy products. An IFSAC food category chart is available from https://www.cdc.gov/foodsafety/ifsac/projects/food-categorization-scheme.html PMID: 28926300
The pH measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid.
Original body habitat where the sample was obtained from
The name of the institution where the sample or DNA extract is held or "sample not available" if the sample was used in its entirety for analysis or otherwise not retained.
new food product categories and food products themselves
To what is the entity pathogenic
The height of subject
Measurement of bacterial carbon production

List of equipment used for planting, fertilization, harvesting, irrigation, land levelling, residue management, weeding or transplanting during the growing season.  This field accepts terms listed under agricultural implement (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000416). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

Expected value: life stage of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples)
Definition: Description of life stage of host.
Note method(s) used for tilling
A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample
Explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction (fresh/frozen/other).
NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606.
Temperature of soil at the time of sampling.
Note method(s) used for tilling

Expected value: FWD: forward primer sequence;REV:reverse primer sequence
Definition: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

Expected value: substrate name of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples)
Definition: The growth substrate of the host.

Expected value: unique identifier of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples)
Definition: A unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified.

Expected value: Add terms that identify the major environment type(s) where your sample was collected. Recommend subclasses of biome [ENVO:00000428]. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes e.g.: mangrove biome [ENVO:01000181]|estuarine biome [ENVO:01000020]
Definition: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class:  http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS

Expected value: Add terms that identify environmental entities having causal influences upon the entity at time of sampling, multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g.: shoreline [ENVO:00000486]|intertidal zone [ENVO:00000316]
Definition: In this field, report the entity or entities which are in your sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. Please use terms that are present in ENVO and which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for env_broad_scale. Format (one term): termLabel [termID]; Format (multiple terms): termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]. Example: Annotating a pooled sample taken from various vegetation layers in a forest consider: canopy [ENVO:00000047]|herb and fern layer [ENVO:01000337]|litter layer [ENVO:01000338]|understory [01000335]|shrub layer [ENVO:01000336]. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here: http://www.obofoundry.org/ontology/envo.html.
Total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host.
speed of wind measured at the time of sampling.

Expected value: Add terms that identify environmental entities having causal influences upon the entity at time of sampling, multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g.: shoreline [ENVO:00000486]|intertidal zone [ENVO:00000316]
Definition: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for env_broad_scale. Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS
Reference or method used in determining the total nitrogen

Information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
A culture isolation date is a date-time entity marking the end of a process in which a sample is isolated as a single colony or non-mixture culture

Packaged kits (containing adapters, indexes, enzymes, buffers etc), tailored for specific sequencing workflows, which allow the simplified preparation of sequencing-ready libraries for small genomes, amplicons, and plasmids.
Total carbon content

Preferred unit: formazin turbidity unit, formazin nephelometric units, nephelometric turbidity units
Definition: Measure of the amount of cloudiness or haziness in water caused by individual particles.

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of nitrite in the sample
Indicate whether multiple DNA extractions were mixed. If the answer yes, the number of extracts that were pooled should be given

A reference to a place on the Earth, by its name or by its geographical location that refers to a distribution point along the food chain. This field accepts terms listed under geographic location (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GAZ_00000448). Reference: Adam Diamond, James Barham. Moving Food Along the Value Chain: Innovations in Regional Food Distribution. U.S. Dept. of Agriculture, Agricultural Marketing Service. Washington, DC. March 2012. http://dx.doi.org/10.9752/MS045.03-2012.

Expected value: genotype of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples)
Definition: Observed genotype.
pH measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid.
Age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. Could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, micromole per liter
Definition: Concentration of particulate organic carbon

Item: Interagency Food Safety Analytics Collaboration (IFSAC) category
Definition: The IFSAC food categorization scheme has five distinct levels to which foods can be assigned, depending upon the type of food. First, foods are assigned to one of four food groups (aquatic animals, land animals, plants, and other). Food groups include increasingly specific food categories; dairy, eggs, meat and poultry, and game are in the land animal food group, and the category meat and poultry is further subdivided into more specific categories of meat (beef, pork, other meat) and poultry (chicken, turkey, other poultry). Finally, foods are differentiated by differences in food processing (such as pasteurized fluid dairy products, unpasteurized fluid dairy products, pasteurized solid and semi-solid dairy products, and unpasteurized solid and semi-solid dairy products. An IFSAC food category chart is available from https://www.cdc.gov/foodsafety/ifsac/projects/food-categorization-scheme.html PMID: 28926300.

Preferred unit: mole per gram, mole per liter
Definition: Concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values

Expected value: country or sea name (INSDC or GAZ): region(GAZ), specific location name
Definition: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ)
Reference or method used in determining pH.

Expected value: Environmental entities having causal influences upon the entity at time of sampling.
Definition: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for env_broad_scale. Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

Preferred unit: cubic meter per minute, liters per second
Definition: Ventilation rate of the system in the sampled premises
The microbiological workflow or protocol followed to test for the presence or enumeration of the target microbial analyte(s). Please provide a PubMed or DOI reference for published protocols.
Duration for which the sample was stored. Indicate the duration for which the sample was stored written in ISO 8601 format.
The floor of the building, where the sampling room is located.

Preferred unit: kilowatts per square meter per day, ergs per square centimeter per second
Definition: The amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval.

Preferred unit: gram Carbon per kilogram sample material
Definition: Definition for soil: total organic carbon content of the soil, definition otherwise: total organic carbon content.
Familial relationships to other hosts in the same study; can include multiple relationships

Expected value: seasonal environment name;treatment interval and duration
Definition: Treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. Winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.), treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million, micromole per kilogram
Definition: Concentration of nitrate in the sample
The length of subject.
Ventilation system used in the sampled premises
Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103).
Information about either pedigree or other ancestral information description (e.g. parental variety in case of mutant or selection), e.g. A/3*B (meaning [(A x B) x B] x B)

The device used to collect an environmental sample. This field accepts terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO). This field also accepts terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

Expected value: perturbation type name;perturbation interval and duration
Definition: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types.

Expected value: herbicide name;herbicide amount;treatment interval and duration

Definition: Information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
Literature reference giving growth conditions of the host
Refers to the mesh/pore size used to pre-filter/pre-sort the sample. Materials larger than the size threshold are excluded from the sample

Phenotype of human or other host. For phenotypic quality ontology (pato) (v 2018-03-27) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/pato. For Human Phenotype Ontology (HP) (v 2018-06-13) please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/HP
Description of the soil cover of the sampled soil and percent covered, e.g., bare soil [ENVO:01001616], vegetation (type), manure, irrigation pipe, etc.

Altitude is a term used to identify heights of objects such as airplanes, space shuttles, rockets, atmospheric balloons and heights of places such as atmospheric layers and clouds. It is used to measure the height of an object which is above the earth‚Äôs surface. In this context, the altitude measurement is the vertical distance between the earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air
Reference or method used in determining salinity

Preferred unit: colony forming units per milliliter; colony forming units per gram of dry weight
Definition: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qPCR).

Expected value: dry mass of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples); measurement value
Definition: Measurement of dry mass.

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, micromole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Total nitrogen content of the sample
Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

A culture isolation date is a date-time entity marking the end of a process in which a sample yields a positive result for the target microbial analyte(s) in the form of an isolated colony or colonies.

Expected value: gaseous compound name;gaseous compound amount;treatment interval and duration
Definition: Use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens
Description of the soil type or classification. This field accepts terms under soil (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00001998).  Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.
Concentration of organic carbon

This is the scientific role or category that the subject organism or material has with respect to an investigation.  This field accepts terms listed under specimen source material category (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001237 or http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0100051).

Preferred unit: micromole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million
Definition: Concentration of nitrate in the sample

Elevation of the sampling site is its height above a fixed reference point, most commonly the mean sea level. Elevation is mainly used when referring to points on the earth's surface, while altitude is used for points above the surface, such as an aircraft in flight or a spacecraft in orbit.

Preferred unit: number of organism per cubic meter
Definition: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr).

Preferred unit: milligram per liter, practical salinity unit, percentage
Definition: Salinity is the total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid (in the form of an extract obtained by centrifugation) sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater.

Physical combination of several instances of like material, e.g. RNA extracted from samples or dishes of cell cultures into one big aliquot of cells. Please provide a short description of the samples that were pooled.

The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
Electrical conductivity of water

Elevation of the sampling site is its height above a fixed reference point, most commonly the mean sea level. Elevation is mainly used when referring to points on the earth's surface, while altitude is used for points above the surface, such as an aircraft in flight or a spacecraft in orbit.

Definition: The amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval

Definition: The number of times the sample location is cleaned. Frequency of cleaning might be on a Daily basis, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly or Annually.

Definition: List of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at https://www.disease-ontology.org.

Expected value: disease name or Disease Ontology term
Definition: List of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at https://www.disease-ontology.org, non-human host diseases are free text.

Expected value: Environmental entities having causal influences upon the entity at time of sampling.
Definition: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for env_broad_scale. Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS

Expected value: for cultures of microorganisms: identifiers for two culture collections; for other material a unique arbitrary identifier
Definition: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).
True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original temperature was measured (e.g. 1345 m)
Ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen

Expected value: reference to amplification method; clean-up method

We recommend using subclasses of ENVO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. Format (one term): termLabel [termID], Format (multiple terms): termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]. Example: Annotating a water sample from the photic zone in middle of the Atlantic Ocean, consider: oceanic epipelagic zone biome [ENVO:01000033]. Example: Annotating a sample from the Amazon rainforest consider: tropical moist broadleaf forest biome [ENVO:01000228]. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here: http://www.obofoundry.org/ontology/envo.html.

A descriptor for the method of movement of food commodity along the food distribution system. This field accepts terms listed under travel mode (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001064). If the proper descrptor is not listed please use text to describe the mode of travel. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

Preferred unit: gram per cubic meter, gram per cubic centimeter, kilogram per cubic meter
Definition: Density of the sample, which is its mass per unit volume (aka volumetric mass density)

Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.

Expected value: name and version of software, parameters used
Definition: Tool(s) used for assembly, including version number and parameters

Expected value: names of organisms that the entity is pathogenic to
Definition: To what is the entity pathogenic

Item: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Definition: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term Sample Size (MIXS:0000001).
Conductivity of soil at time of sampling.

Expected value: salt name;salt amount;treatment interval and duration
Preferred unit: gram, microgram, mole per liter, gram per liter
Definition: Information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple salt regimens

Expected value: fungicide name;fungicide amount;treatment interval and duration
Preferred unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple fungicide regimens
Whether or not subject is gravid, and if yes date due or date post-conception, specifying which is used
The name of the institution where the sample or DNA extract is held or "sample not available" if the sample was used in its entirety for analysis or otherwise not retained.
Information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites
NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606

Expected value: common name of the symbiotic organism (host of the samples)
Definition: Common name of the host.

Altitude is a term used to identify heights of objects such as airplanes, space shuttles, rockets, atmospheric balloons and heights of places such as atmospheric layers and clouds. It is used to measure the height of an object which is above the earth's surface. In this context, the altitude measurement is the vertical distance between the earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air.
Measurement of dry mass
Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103).
Type of plant or animal from which the food product or its major ingredient is derived or a chemical food source [FDA CFSAN 1995].

List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. Antibiotics, n fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi
A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

Preferred unit: number of cells per cubic meter, number of cells per milliliter, number of cells per cubic centimeter
Definition: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)
The height of subject.
Type of indoor surface.

Genetic modifications of the genome of an organism, which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means, e.g. specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection.

Item: amount or size of sample collected
Definition: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

Preferred unit: milligrams Nitrogen per kilogram of soil
Definition: Total nitrogen content of the sample.

Expected value: seasonal environment name;treatment interval and duration
Definition: Treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. Winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.), treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment

The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. For sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
Description of the soil type or classification. This field accepts terms under soil (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00001998).  Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

Preferred unit: microgram per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million, micromole per kilogram
Definition: Dissolved inorganic carbon concentration in the sample, typically measured after filtering the sample using a 0.45 micrometer filter
Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

List of chemical compounds administered to the symbiont, its host, or environment where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v 111), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI.
Measurement of the culture rooting medium macronutrients (N,P, K, Ca, Mg, S); e.g. KH2PO4 (170¬†mg/L).

Information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of ph of the growth media, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimen
Reference or method used in determining salinity.
pH of some soil.
True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original pressure was measured (e.g. 1578 m).

Preferred unit: mole per liter, microgram per gram sample
Definition: Concentration of alkyl diethers

The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008; Except: 2008-01; 2008 all are ISO8601 compliant

Expected value: Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
Definition: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. For sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
Concentration of organic nitrogen
Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here.

List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. Antibiotics, n fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi.
Morphological shape of host

Expected value: pesticide name;pesticide amount;treatment interval and duration
Preferred unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple pesticide regimens

PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

Sample Name is a name that you choose for the sample. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible. Every Sample Name from a single Submitter must be unique.

Expected value: non-mineral nutrient name;non-mineral nutrient amount;treatment interval and duration
Preferred unit: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter
Definition: Information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens

Expected value: The material displaced by the entity at time of sampling. Recommend subclasses of environmental material [ENVO:00010483].
Definition: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top). If the sample collected is a symbiont and the sequenced entity is a symbiont of that sampled symbiont, this field describes the tissue or excretion of the symbiotic host organism, not the top-level host.

Concentration of substances that remain suspended in the air, and comprise mixtures of organic and inorganic substances (PM10 and PM2.5); can report multiple PM's by entering numeric values preceded by name of PM
Age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. Could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees.
Porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample
